Description: 29 sherds, some of them glued together, from different Nubian handmade vessels, Kerma Moyen? One is a rim fragment with AWS 203 written on it, at the outside incised triangles with a hatched line pattern. The other fragments are body sherds, all black inside and red at the outside.
Dimensions: Height: 12.10 centimetres (Measurements refer to largest glued fragment)
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
